title: Add ripgrep-based text search tool
description:
Implement fast text search tool using ripgrep with grep fallback.

## Objective
Create a grep_search tool that provides fast regex-based code searching, similar to cursor-agent's implementation.

## Implementation Details
- Tool function: grep_search(pattern, file_glob, case_sensitive, context_lines)
- Primary: Use ripgrep (rg) if available
- Fallback: Use standard grep if ripgrep not installed
- Return structured results with file paths, line numbers, and context
- Register with ToolRegistry at SAFE risk level

## Technical Approach
1. Create src/consoul/ai/tools/grep_search.py
2. Detect ripgrep availability with subprocess
3. Build command with proper escaping
4. Parse output into structured format
5. Add error handling and validation
6. Write unit tests

## Acceptance Criteria
- Works with and without ripgrep installed
- Supports file glob patterns (e.g., '*.py')
- Case sensitive/insensitive options
- Context lines before/after matches
- Returns JSON-serializable results
- Handles binary files gracefully
- Performance: <1s for typical repo search

## Dependencies
- ripgrep (optional, user-installed)
- subprocess module (built-in)

## Testing
- Unit tests with mock subprocess
- Integration tests with real files
- Test with/without ripgrep
- Test various glob patterns

## Documentation
- Docstring with examples
- Add to tools.md guide
- Usage examples in SDK docs

## Estimated Effort
4-6 hours
